Control.Text: This aura will always be shown.
Control.Name: ShownDescription

Control.Text: Many auras have already been created by other players, check our wiki for codes for existing auras and contribute your own!
Control.Name: TabDescription

Control.Text: Hint: Use the padlock in the aura list to allow icons to be dragged
Control.Name: BuffPositionHintLabel

Control.Text: This sound will be played when no triggers pass.
Control.Name: PlaySoundDescription
OverlayHelp
Control.Tooltip: Once you've chosen your icon above, you can customize the overlay using these options. The solid option will display the overlay as a fixed square, while the icon option limits it to the edges of your icon. Choose whether you want the overlay to be Linear or Radial. Then, you can choose the icon color and the overlay color using the boxes below.

Control.Name: SoundHelp
Control.Tooltip: Choose when you want your sound to play, similar to the shown dropdown in the General tab. Then chose what sound you want in the list to the right. The sound will play when you select it. Choose none at the top of the list if you want no sound to play.

Control.Text: This feature is currently under active development, and as such only works with buff, debuff and health trigger types. If you encounter any issues with this feature, please post it on Curse or GitHub.
Control.Name: Window1
CustomSoundHelp
Control.Tooltip: If you choose to use a custom sound, please it in '%APPDATA%\NCSOFT\WildStar\Addons\AuraMastery\Sounds\', and enter the filename here. e.g. 'beware.wav'.

Control.Text: WARNING: Removing a group will delete all auras within the group!
Control.Name: RemoveWarningLabel

Control.Text: Note: Once you enter advanced mode, you will not be able to return
Control.Name: AdvanceModeLabel

Control.Text: To get started, use the 'Add Aura' button in the left to add a new aura.
Control.Name: Window1
OnHelp
Control.Tooltip: Chose here, whether you want your effect to occur when the trigger succeeds (Pass) or fails (Fail). For timed effects, enable the 'Timed' checkbox, and enter a duration in seconds.

Control.Text: Select a type for this trigger.
Control.Name: TriggerTypeLabel
BehaviourHelp
Control.Tooltip: This is one of the most important options in your triggers tab. This sets the behaviour of the type of trigger you have selected. View the tooltips in the dropdown for information on each option.

Control.Name: TriggerTypeCooldown
Control.Tooltip: Cooldown Trigger monitors the cooldowns of your abilities. Recommended setting to fail in behaviour dropdown.

Control.Name: TriggerTypeBuff
Control.Tooltip: Buff Trigger monitors the buffs of player or players target. Trigger will activate when the buff is present.

Control.Name: TriggerTypeDebuff
Control.Tooltip: Debuff Trigger monitors the debuffs of player or players target. Trigger will activate when the debuff is present.

Control.Name: TriggerTypeOn Critical
Control.Tooltip: Critical Trigger will activate when you crit an attack, letting you know when 'On Critical' abilities can be used. Medics, Stalkers & Warriors should use Buff Trigger instead. Tracking Clear!, Punish and Breaching Strikes respectively.

Control.Name: TriggerTypeOn Deflect
Control.Tooltip: Deflect Trigger will activate when you deflect an attack, letting you know when 'On Deflect' abilities can be cast. Best paired with a Cooldown Trigger.

Control.Name: TriggerTypeResources
Control.Tooltip: Resource Trigger monitors the focus or secondary resource of player or the players target. You set the amount that will activate the trigger.

Control.Name: TriggerTypeHealth
Control.Tooltip: Health Trigger monitors the health or shields of player or the players target. You set the amount that will activate the trigger.

Control.Name: TriggerTypeMoment Of Opportunity
Control.Tooltip: MOO Trigger activates when opponent is weakened by interupting their cast. I.e. the purple health frame.

Control.Name: TriggerTypeScriptable
Control.Tooltip: Scriptable trigger for advanced users.

Control.Name: TriggerTypeKeybind
Control.Tooltip: Keybind Tracker will monitor the keybind you've set. When the key is pressed, the trigger will activate until the specified duration ends.

Control.Name: TriggerTypeLimited Action Set Checker
Control.Tooltip: A Limited Action Set Checker checks your current loadout for the ability that you specify.

Control.Name: TriggerTypeGadget
Control.Tooltip: Checks the cooldown of your currently equipped gadget.

Control.Name: TriggerTypeCast
Control.Tooltip: Checks for the specified spell cast

Control.Name: TriggerTypeICD
Control.Tooltip: Checks elapsed time since event occured.

Control.Name: TriggerBehaviourPass
Control.Tooltip: This behaviour makes your aura appear when your trigger succeeds. This is useful for most triggers, if you want your aura to appear when the trigger has detected what it is looking for.

Control.Name: TriggerBehaviourFail
Control.Tooltip: This behaviour makes your aura appear when the trigger does not succeed. This is useful for tracking cooldowns where you want your aura to disappear when your ability is on cooldown.

Control.Name: TriggerBehaviourIgnore
Control.Tooltip: With this behaviour, your trigger will always succeed, and will also give you information on what it is watching. This is useful for timers and stacks where you want your icon to always appear.

Control.Text: Recepients must have enabled the 'Allow Share Requests' button above.
Control.Name: Window
UnitHelp
Control.Tooltip: Decide whether you want to track yourself (Player), or your target (Target).

Control.Name: SpellNameHelp
Control.Tooltip: Enter the name of the debuff you want to track exactly as it is shown ingame (Including CAPS and punctuation!).

Control.Name: StacksHelp
Control.Tooltip: Check the stacks box if you want to enable tracking stacks. Using the dropdown, decide whether you want greater than (>), less than (<), etc than the number you specify.

Control.Name: StacksHelp
Control.Tooltip: Check the stacks box if you want to enable tracking stacks. Using the dropdown, decide whether you want greater than (>), less than (<), etc than the number you specify.

Control.Name: SpellNameHelp
Control.Tooltip: Enter the name of the debuff you want to track exactly as it is shown ingame (Including CAPS and punctuation!).

Control.Name: UnitHelp
Control.Tooltip: Decide whether you want to track yourself (Player), or your target (Target).

Control.Name: SpellName
Control.Tooltip: Name of the spell to track the cooldown of. Leave blank to use the Aura name.

Control.Name: SpellNameHelp
Control.Tooltip: Enter the name of the ability you want to track exactly as it is shown ingame (Including CAPS and punctuation!). For bot abilities, prefix the ability with '[Bot Abilitiy]', for example '[Bot Ability] Barrage'.

Control.Name: ChargesHelp
Control.Tooltip: Check the charges box if you want to enable tracking charges. Using the dropdown, decide whether you want greater than (>), less than (<), etc than the number you specify.

Control.Name: ResourceHelp
Control.Tooltip: Choose whether you want to use focus or secondary resource (i.e. Actuators, Spellsurge, Suit Power, etc) using the checkboxes, then check tracking percentage or value using the checkbox. Finally, enter your value and decide whether it should be greater than (>), less than (<), etc than the number you have specified.

Control.Name: HealthHelp
Control.Tooltip: Choose whether you want to use health or shields using the checkboxes, then check tracking percentage or value using the checkbox. Finally, enter your value and decide whether it should be greater than (>), less than (<), etc than the number you have specified.

Control.Name: KeyToTrackHelp
Control.Tooltip: Enter the keybind you want to track, use CAPS for letters.

Control.Name: DurationHelp
Control.Tooltip: Enter the time you want your trigger to activate for, in seconds

Control.Text: On Critical triggers need no special configuration. Just select the behaviour like you normally would, as well as deciding if you want an effect for this trigger.
Control.Name: On Critical

Control.Text: For Medics, Warriors and Stalkers, you are advised to instead use a buff trigger tracking Clear!, Breaching Strikes or Punish respectively.
Control.Name: Window

Control.Text: On Deflect triggers need no special configuration. Just select the behaviour like you normally would, as well as deciding if you want an effect for this trigger.
Control.Name: On Deflect
AbilityName
Control.Tooltip: Name of the spell to track the cooldown of. Leave blank to use the Aura name.

Control.Name: SpellNameHelp
Control.Tooltip: Enter the name of the spell you wish to check for on your LAS. Make sure you spell it exactly as it is on the spell (including CAPS and punctuation!).

Control.Name: UnitHelp
Control.Tooltip: Decide whether you want to track yourself (Player), or your target (Target).

Control.Name: SpellNameHelp
Control.Tooltip: Enter the name of the debuff you want to track exactly as it is shown ingame (Including CAPS and punctuation!).

Control.Name: SpellNameHelp
Control.Tooltip: Enter the name of the debuff you want to track exactly as it is shown ingame (Including CAPS and punctuation!).

Control.Name: UnitHelp
Control.Tooltip: Decide whether you want to track yourself (Player), or your target (Target).

Control.Name: DurationHelp
Control.Tooltip: Elapsed time after event occurs for the trigger to remain active.
